relation: Hang out with friends and enjoy the scenery. The campus is very pretty on a sunny day in the spring when all the flowers are out.
I tend to bring my own lunch so I don't have to spend money on eating out everyday.
Depending on the class you are in and who your professor is is the deciding factor.
If you don't like a class switch out of it right away. Online classes here aren't the greatest.
Small classes hands on and very professional. I am enjoying all of may classes at Whatcom and am learning a lot from my teachers.
pageTitle: Whatcom Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Caitlin from Bellingham, WA 12/13/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 2 of 26 Categories Comments Great for these types of students WCC is great for students who are still trying to figure out what they want to do as a career, earn college credit and not break the bank. Many students fresh out of high school choose to go to WCC in order to gain a transfer degree so they don't have to pay for four years at a University. Also there are many returning adult students gaining more education to get better jobs. Tips for prospective students To a prospective student I would say to get to know an adviser to make sure you are on track for the degree you want. It is easy to let necessary credits slip through the cracks. I would also suggest participating in class, many professors at WCC grade on participation because of the smaller classes and your input matters! Finally, I suggest joining a
